Alustriel’s Mooncloak.name: 艾拉斯卓的月辉之篷
Alustriel’s Mooncloak.description:
月光从天而降，在持续时间内以微光光照笼罩源自你的 20 尺光环区域。你和你的盟友在位于该区域期间获得半身掩护及对寒冷、闪电及光耀伤害的抗性。

在法术持续时间内，你可以使用以下选项之一（但这将令此法术立即结束）：

解放。当你失败于一次用于避免或结束恐慌、受擒及束缚的豁免时，你可以用一个反应来将本次豁免改为成功。

回春。以一个魔法动作，你或区域内的一名盟友恢复等于 4d10 + 你的施法属性调整值点生命值。

Liberation.name: 解放
Liberation.condition: 当你失败于一次用于避免或结束恐慌、受擒及束缚的豁免时

Moonlight.name: 月光
Moonlight.description: 你和你的盟友在位于该区域期间获得半身掩护及对寒冷、闪电及光耀伤害的抗性。

Backlash.name: 反冲术
Backlash.description:
你将破坏性的能量抵御并弹开，令该次你受到的伤害降低 4d6 + 你的施法属性调整值点。

若触发该次反应的伤害来自一名位于施法距离内的生物，则你可以迫使该生物进行一次体质豁免。豁免失败则其受到 4d6 力场伤害，豁免成功则仅受半伤。

升环施法。 你使用的法术位每比四环高一环，法术能减免的伤害量和造成的力场伤害就都增加 1d6 。

Creature Backlash.name: Creature Backlash
Creature Backlash.condition: triggering damage was from a creature within range

Banneret.name: 旗将
Banneret.description:
用振奋人心的领导力集结同道英雄

旗将是那些保护无辜者，并将冒险者团结在正义和自由事业中、象征英勇无畏和领导气概、为了正义和自由的事业而奋斗的人中典范。许多旗将以骑士的身份，在科米尔、银色联邦、达马拉、阙森塔或费伦大地上的其他地方服役。他们以流浪骑士的身份行于国度各地，在王国边境之外与邪恶作斗争。

旗将依靠判断力，勇气和对骑士精神的坚守来引导他们打败恶人。一个孤身行动的旗将是一个技艺高超的战士，但当他们带领一群盟友时，只要有一位旗将在此，即使是装备简陋的民兵小队也能变成一支凶猛的战团。

Amethyst Dragon Den.name: Amethyst Dragon Den
Amethyst Dragon Den.description:
Level 5 Bastion Facility

Prerequisite: Membership in the Purple Dragon Knights

Space: Vast

Hirelings: 1

Order: Empower

This den for an amethyst dragon is an enclosed open chamber with a pool, and one of its entrances is underwater. The facility’s hireling maintains the den and helps any visiting amethyst dragons feel comfortable.

Empower: Psionic Defenses. When you issue the Empower order to this facility, latent draconic power fills the facility, allowing you to train in psionic combat. This training takes 8 hours per day for 7 days, after which you gain Resistance to Psychic damage. This benefit lasts for 7 days.

Cult of the Dragon Archive.name: 龙巫教档案馆
Cult of the Dragon Archive.description:
13 级据点设施

先决条件： 龙巫教成员

空间：宽敞

雇员：1

指令：调查

龙巫教档案馆中收录了涵盖许多特定主题的详实资料，包括关于龙类的内容。

调查：有益学识。当你对此设施下达调查指令时，你委托设施雇员针对传说档案进行研究。这项工作需要 7 天时间。雇员会如同施展了通晓传奇法术一般获得这些知识，并且会在下一次交谈时与你分享。

参考书。 你的龙巫教档案馆收录了大量的龙类传说。当你在据点内时，你在因回忆有关龙类的传说而执行研究动作时所进行的智力（自然或宗教）检定中具有优势。

扩大设施。 你可以花费 2000GP，将龙巫教档案馆扩大为庞大设施。这样做后，你会获得两本在《城主指南》第八章@UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.content.JournalEntry.dmgBastions00000.JournalEntryPage.grKY1o6q5Qfyzr1a#archive]中列出的两本参考书。

Emerald Enclave Grove.name: 翠绿闲庭林居
Emerald Enclave Grove.description:
9级据点设施

先决： 翠绿闲庭成员

空间： 庞大

雇员： 2

指令：招募

翠绿闲庭的资深成员能够塑造出一片由树木、青草与流水构成的安宁圣所，让那些身上体现着自然之力的魔法生物在此安居。这个翠绿闲庭林居可容纳一只巨型生物，或两只大型生物；每四只中型或小型生物在这里占据的空间等同于一只大型生物。

招募：自然生灵。当你对此设施下达招募指令时，你可从翠绿闲庭林居生物表中邀请一只生物入驻你的翠绿闲庭林居。投掷 [[/r 1d2]]{die} 。若结果为奇数，该生物拒绝了你的邀请，你本次指令无效；若结果为偶数，该生物接受邀请并将在7日后来到你的翠绿闲庭林居。你的雇员将负责照料该生物并维护此设施。

在你翠绿闲庭林居中的生物视为你的据点卫兵。如果它们遭受任何损失，便将损失的生物从你的据点卫兵名单中划去。你可以选择不将一只或更多生物视为据点卫兵，此时这些生物不会参与据点的防御，而是按照自己的天性活动，使用《怪物图鉴》中的数据。

Harper Hideout.name: Harper Hideout
Harper Hideout.description:
Level 5 Bastion Facility

Prerequisite: Membership in the Harpers

Space: Roomy

Hirelings: 1

Order: Empower

You have a safe house hidden near your Bastion and connected to it by a tunnel no more than a quarter mile in length. Your hireling maintains the hideout, using a cover identity that doesn’t link them to your Bastion. You can change the location of your Harper Hideout each time you gain a level.

Hideout Defenses. Your Harper Hideout is constantly protected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplAlarm00000]{Alarm} spell. At level 9, your Harper Hideout can be connected to your Bastion by a magic doorway instead of a tunnel; anyone passing through the door from the Harper Hideout emerges from a specific door in your Bastion or vice versa, and your Harper Hideout can be located anywhere within 100 miles of your Bastion. At level 13, the facility can be located anywhere in Faerûn. At level 17, the magic doorway works across planes, and the facility can be anywhere in the multiverse.

Empower: Harper Training. When you issue the Empower order to this facility, the facility’s hireling extends an invitation to another Harper agent nearby. Roll any die. If the number is odd, no Harper needs your facility and you gain no benefit from having issued the order. If the number rolled is even, a Friendly Harper takes up temporary residence in your hideout.

The Harper stays for 7 days. While at your Bastion, the Harper can share their knowledge. Any character who trains with the Harper here for at least 8 hours on each of those days gains proficiency in one of the following skills of their choice: Deception, Investigation, or Performance. This benefit lasts for 7 days.

The Harper won’t defend your Bastion and departs immediately if the Bastion is attacked.

Train.name: Train
Train.condition: 8 hours of training each day for 7 days.

Harper Training: Deception.name: Harper Training: Deception
Harper Training: Deception.description: Any character who trains with the Harper here for at least 8 hours on each of those days gains proficiency in one of the following skills of their choice: Deception, Investigation, or Performance. This benefit lasts for 7 days.

Harper Training: Investigation.name: Harper Training: Investigation
Harper Training: Investigation.description: Any character who trains with the Harper here for at least 8 hours on each of those days gains proficiency in one of the following skills of their choice: Deception, Investigation, or Performance. This benefit lasts for 7 days.

Harper Training: Performance.description: Any character who trains with the Harper here for at least 8 hours on each of those days gains proficiency in one of the following skills of their choice: Deception, Investigation, or Performance. This benefit lasts for 7 days.

Lords' Alliance Noble Residence.name: Lords' Alliance Noble Residence
Lords' Alliance Noble Residence.description:
Level 9 Bastion Facility

Prerequisite: Membership in the Lords’ Alliance

Space: Vast

Hirelings: 1

Order: Recruit

You maintain a luxurious apartment fit for the ruler of a city such as Neverwinter, Waterdeep, or Baldur’s Gate. Your hireling is a butler who tends to the resident’s needs.

After spending a Long Rest in your Noble Residence, you gain &Reference[Inspiration].

Recruit: Visiting Noble. When you issue the Recruit order to your Lords’ Alliance Noble Residence, you forgo sleeping in it for 14 days and instead make it available to a noble from a settlement that is a member of the Lords’ Alliance. Roll any [[/r 1d2]]{die}. If the number rolled is odd, no one accepts your invitation and you gain no benefit from having issued the order. If the number rolled is even, a noble from the settlement you chose accepts your invitation, arriving within 7 days and staying for another 7 days.

The visiting noble gossips about events and inhabitants in their home settlement, revealing to you the location of any creature familiar to you if that creature is within 50 miles of the settlement from which the noble has come, if that creature isn’t hidden by magic, and if that creature isn’t confined to a location that the DM deems beyond the noble’s ability to know. If the noble knows the location of the individual, they also tell you where that creature was for the 7 days prior to the noble’s departure for your Bastion.

The visiting noble won’t defend your Bastion and departs immediately if the Bastion is attacked.

Order of the Gauntlet Tournament Field.name: Order of the Gauntlet Tournament Field
Order of the Gauntlet Tournament Field.description:
Level 9 Bastion Facility

Prerequisite: Membership in the Order of the Gauntlet

Space: Vast

Hirelings: 1

Order: Empower

The Order of the Gauntlet Tournament Field is a marked-off area for combat between two armed individuals. It includes room for spectators.

Your hireling is a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmKnight00000000]{Knight} whose alignment matches your own. If your Bastion lacks facilities to house this knight, the knight secures accommodations in the inn or settlement closest to the Bastion. This knight isn’t a Bastion Defender, but if your Bastion is attacked, the knight reduces by 1 the number of dice you roll to determine how many Bastion Defenders are lost in the attack.

Empower: Hold Tournament. When you issue the Empower order to this facility, you host a tournament at your Bastion. It takes 7 days for word of the tournament to spread to nearby settlements, and another 7 days for contestants to travel to your Bastion and participate in the tournament. You must spend 2,000 GP for prizes. At the conclusion of the tournament, your Renown Score with the Order of the Gauntlet increases by 1.

Red Wizard Necropolis.name: Red Wizard Necropolis
Red Wizard Necropolis.description:
Level 5 Bastion Facility

Prerequisite: Membership in the Red Wizards, ability to use a Spellcasting Focus

Space: Roomy

Hirelings: 1

Order: Recruit

Red Wizards defend their strongholds with Undead minions. A Red Wizard Necropolis can accommodate up to eight Bastion Defenders.

Recruit: Undead Defenders. Each time you issue the Recruit action to this facility, up to four Undead Bastion Defenders are created and take shelter in the crypts and burial chambers of your Red Wizard Necropolis. You can’t issue the Recruit order to this facility if it’s fully occupied.

Keep track of Undead Bastion Defenders you lose and deduct them from your Bastion Defenders roster. An Undead Bastion Defender returns to your Red Wizard Necropolis 14 days after being destroyed. Undead Bastion Defenders can’t return from being killed if the facility is shut down or fully occupied.

Zhentarim Travel Station.name: Zhentarim Travel Station
Zhentarim Travel Station.description:
Level 5 Bastion Facility

Prerequisite: Membership in the Zhentarim

Space: Vast

Hirelings: 2

Order: Research

The Zhentarim maintain stations to facilitate safe and swift long-distance travel on journeys (see @UUID[Compendium.dnd-dungeon-masters-guide.content.JournalEntry.dmgRunningExplor.JournalEntryPage.QrGAynDfEKmKX14L]{chapter 2} of the Dungeon Master’s Guide). Your travel station includes temporary stabling facilities for four Large creatures; two Medium creatures occupy the same space as one Large creature there. The facility’s hirelings look after these creatures.

Long-Distance Travel Speed. Finishing a Long Rest in your Bastion better prepares you for travel; your group’s maximum travel pace increases by one step (from Slow to Normal or from Normal to Fast).

Research: Reconnaissance. When you issue the Research order to this facility, you commission the Zhentarim Travel Station’s hirelings to gather information that facilitates an upcoming journey. This work takes 7 days. For the duration of the journey, you have Advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to forage or navigate.

Zhentarim Reconnaissnace.name: Zhentarim Reconnaissnace
Zhentarim Reconnaissnace.description: For the duration of the journey, you have Advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to forage or navigate.

Blade of Disaster.name: 灾厄之刃
Blade of Disaster.description:
You create a 3-foot-long blade-shaped planar rift that lasts for the duration. The rift appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make up to two melee spell attacks, each one against a creature or object within 5 feet of the rift. On a hit, the target takes 10d6 Force damage. This attack scores a Critical Hit if the number on the d20 is 18 or higher.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the rift up to 60 feet and repeat the two attacks against a creature or an object within 5 feet of it. You can direct the attacks at the same target or at different ones.

The blade can harmlessly pass through any barrier, including ones created by spells like @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplWallofForc]{Wall of Force}.

Bladesinger.name: 剑咏者
Bladesinger.description:
御剑唤法，灵动优雅

剑咏者们掌握着一种将剑术与舞蹈相结合的奥法传承。在战斗中，剑咏者会运用一系列错综复杂而又不失优雅的招式来抵御伤害，并将魔法导入毁灭性的攻击和精妙的防御中。许多曾目睹过剑咏者展露技艺之人，都将那番景象视为其一生中最为美妙的经历之一——那是一场华丽之舞，伴随着高歌之剑刃。

剑咏与古代的精灵社会有着紧密联系，是他们最先掌握了这项技艺并为其取名。即便时至今日，大多数的剑咏者仍然出身于古老的精灵国度，如迷斯卓诺Myth Drannor，或是来自于那些与精灵们共享地域、交融历史的非精灵社会，如银月联邦Silver Marches。无论出身于何处，剑咏者们皆是为了帮助普通民众以及成就英雄伟业，而把他们的天赋带到了国度各处。大多数社群都将剑咏者的到来视为一个好兆头。

Bladesong.name: 剑歌
Bladesong.description:
作为一个附赠动作，你唤起一种被称为剑歌Bladesong的精灵魔法，前提是你没有着装护甲或使用盾牌。

该剑歌持续1分钟，并会在你陷入失能状态，着装护甲或盾牌，或者双手并用一把武器发动攻击时提前结束。你可以随时解除剑歌（无需动作）。

剑歌激活期间，你获得以下增益。你能够唤起剑歌的次数等于你的智力调整值 ([[lookup @abilities.int.mod]]{0}, 至少1次), 完成一次长休后，你重获所有已消耗的使用次数。当你使用奥术回想时，你会恢复一次已消耗的使用次数。

灵动。 你的AC获得等同于你智力调整值的加值（最低+1），且你的速度增加10尺。此外，你进行敏捷（特技）检定时具有优势。

剑法。 当你使用你具有熟练的武器进行攻击时，你可以使用你的智力调整值替代力量或敏捷来进行攻击与伤害掷骰。

专注。 当你为维持专注而进行体质豁免时，你可以将你的智力调整值加到掷骰总值当中。

Foundry Note

所包含的效应不会修改用于攻击与伤害掷骰的调整值。此项修改应在所使用武器的 攻击 行动组合中完成。

Regain Use (Arcane Recovery).name: 恢复使用次数（奥术回想）

Extra Attack.name: 额外攻击
Extra Attack.description: 你在你的回合内执行攻击动作时，可以进行两次攻击而非一次。此外，你可以将额外攻击中的一次，替换为施展你的一道施法时间为动作的法师戏法。

Song of Defense.name: 守御之歌
Song of Defense.description: 在你的剑歌激活期间，当你受到伤害时，你可以执行反应以消耗一枚法术位并将该伤害降低等同于该法术位环阶5倍的数值。

utility.condition: 在你的剑歌激活期间，当你受到伤害时

Song of Victory.name: 胜利之歌
Song of Victory.description: 在你施展了一道施法时间为动作的法术之后，你可以执行附赠动作用武器进行一次攻击。

Training in War and Song.name: 战歌训练
Training in War and Song.description:
你获得所有不具有双手及重型词条的近战军用武器熟练。你可以使用你具有熟练的近战武器作为你法师法术的施法法器。

此外，你获得下列你所选择的一项技能的熟练：特技、运动、表演或游说。

Boon of Bloodshed.name: 血海漂橹之恩惠
Boon of Bloodshed.description:
你获得以下增益：

属性值提升。 你选择的一项属性提升1，至多提升至30。

杀手机运。 当一名你可见的敌人生命值降至0时，你的下次攻击检定获得优势，持续至你的下个回合结束。

痛心切骨。 每回合一次，当你在浴血期间进行攻击检定时，你可以额外对目标造成等于熟练加值的伤害。额外伤害的伤害类型与该攻击的伤害类型一致。

Foundry Note

此特性包含一个“杀手机运”激活效应，该状态仅作为效果提示，不会自动化应用优势。此外，“痛心切骨”激活效应仅会在角色处于浴血状态时提供攻击检定伤害加值，且应在每回合首次使用后禁用效应。

Killer’s Fortune.name: 杀手机运
Killer’s Fortune.condition: 当一名你可见的敌人生命值降至0时

Power from Pain.name: 痛心切骨
Power from Pain.condition: 当你在浴血期间进行攻击检定时

Killer's Fortune (Attack Advantage).name: 杀手机运（攻击优势）
Killer's Fortune (Attack Advantage).description: 在你的下个回合结束前，你进行的下一次攻击具有优势。

Power from Pain (Bloodied Damage).name: 痛心切骨（浴血伤害）
Power from Pain (Bloodied Damage).description: 每回合一次，当你在浴血期间进行攻击检定时，你可以额外对目标造成等于熟练加值的伤害。

Feat Ability Score Improvement.hint: Your feat allows you to increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 30.

Boon of Bountiful Health.name: Boon of Bountiful Health
Boon of Bountiful Health.description:
You gain the following benefits.

Ability Score Increase. Increase one ability score of your choice by 1, to a maximum of 30.

Augmented Health. When you gain Temporary Hit Points, increase the number of Temporary Hit Points you gain by 5.

Superior Recuperation. When you spend one or more Hit Point Dice to regain Hit Points, you can instead use the highest number possible for each die.

Foundry Note

Multiple Superior Recuperation activities are provided, which can be used in lieu of the standard Hit Dice rolling application and will use the highest possible roll for each die size.

Superior Recuperation (d12).condition: you spend one or more d12 Hit Point Dice to regain Hit Points

Boon of Communication.name: Boon of Communication
Boon of Communication.description:
Epic Boon Feat (Prerequisite: Level 19+)

You gain the following benefits.

Ability Score Increase. Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 30.

Cunning Speaker. You don’t have Disadvantage on ability checks to influence Hostile creatures.

Gifted Interpreter. You understand the literal meaning of any language you hear or see signed, and you can understand the literal meaning of any written language you see.

Mental Communication. You gain telepathy with a range of 120 feet.

Mental Communication.name: Mental Communication
Mental Communication.description: You gain telepathy with a range of 120 feet.

Feat Ability Score Improvement.title: Feat Ability Score Improvement
Feat Ability Score Improvement.hint: Your feat allows you to increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 30.

Boon of Desperate Resilience.name: Boon of Desperate Resilience
Boon of Desperate Resilience.description:
You gain the following benefits.

Ability Score Increase. Increase your Strength or Constitution score by 1, to a maximum of 30.

Defense of Body and Mind. While you are Bloodied, you have Resistance to every damage type except Force.

Shapechanger. You can take a Magic action to shape-shift into a Beast, Humanoid, or Monstrosity with a Challenge Rating no higher than 10. When you shape-shift, you gain a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points of the form. The shape-shifting effect lasts for 1 hour, and it ends early if you have no Temporary Hit Points left or if you take a Magic action to return to your true form.

Upon shape-shifting, you determine whether your equipment drops to the ground or changes in size and shape to fit the new form while you’re in it.

Once you use this benefit, you can’t do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

Hardy Transformation. When you gain Temporary Hit Points when you shape-shift, increase that number of Temporary Hit Points by 20.

Conjure Constructs.description:
You conjure a group of intangible, orderly spirits that appear as a Medium group of modrons or other Constructs in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The spirits last for the duration.

When you cast this spell and as a Magic action on subsequent turns, you can command the spirits to target one creature or object you can see within 5 feet of the spirits and create one of the following effects:

Clockwork Force. The target makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d6 Force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Orderly Ward. The target gains Temporary Hit Points equal to 1d6 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

When you move on your turn, you can also move the spirits up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

If the target succeeds on the save or when the effect ends for a target, the target is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

Deathly power fills a 60-foot Emanation originating from you for the duration.

A creature that fails its save against the spell’s effect also gains 1 Exhaustion level. While the creature has Exhaustion levels, finishing a Long Rest neither restores lost Hit Points nor reduces the creature’s Exhaustion level.

When the spell is cast, each secondary caster must expend a level 4+ spell slot; otherwise, the spell fails.

Doomtide.description:
You create a 20-foot-radius Sphere of inky fog within range. The fog is magical Darkness and lasts for the duration or until a strong wind (such as the one created by the Gust of Wind spell) disperses it, ending the spell.

Each creature in the Sphere when it appears makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 5d6 Psychic damage and subtracts 1d6 from its saving throws until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A creature also makes this save when the Sphere moves into its space, when it enters the Sphere, or when it ends its turn inside the Sphere. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

The Sphere moves 10 feet away from you at the start of each of your turns.

Casting as a Circle Spell. Casting this as a Circle spell requires a minimum of five secondary casters. In addition to the spell’s usual components, you must provide a special component (a string of three black pearls from Pandemonium), which the spell consumes. The spell’s range increases to 1 mile, and its duration increases to until dispelled (no Concentration required). The spell ends early if any caster who participated in this casting contributes to another casting of Doomtide as a Circle spell.

When the spell is cast, each secondary caster must expend a level 3+ spell slot; otherwise, the spell fails.

Clerics who tap into this domain study esoteric lore, collect old tomes, delve into secret places, and examine the processes of the mind. Libraries, universities, and other educational institutions also draw on the power of the Knowledge Domain.

Gods of knowledge vary from masters of arcane magic to patrons of craft and invention. In Faerûn, Clerics of the Knowledge Domain worship deities of learning and ingenuity such as Oghma and Gond, among many others.

Oath of the Noble Genies.name: Oath of the Noble Genies
Oath of the Noble Genies.description:
Brandish the Elemental Splendor of Genies

Paladins sworn to the Oath of the Noble Genies revere the forces of the Elemental Planes. Through taking this oath, Paladins draw power from the four different types of genies—dao, masters of earth; djinn, masters of air; efreet, masters of fire; and marids, masters of water. In Faerûn, many Paladins who swear this oath hail from Calimshan, a land teeming with genies.

Paladins who swear this oath often undertake quests that take them all over the Realms and across the multiverse—including the Elemental Planes. These paladins share the following tenets:

  • Sow the seeds of creation amid the ashes of destruction.
  • Lead with splendor and grace.
  • Respect the elements, and fear their wrath.

Aura of Elemental Shielding.name: Aura of Elemental Shielding
Aura of Elemental Shielding.description:
Choose one of the following damage types: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder. You and your allies have Resistance to that damage type while in your Aura of Protection.

At the start of each of your turns, you can change the damage type affected by this feature to one of the other listed options (no action required).

Elemental Rebuke.name: Elemental Rebuke
Elemental Rebuke.description:
When you are hit by an attack roll, you can take a Reaction to halve the attack’s damage against yourself (round down) and force the attacker to make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the attacker takes damage equal to 2d10 plus your Charisma modifier of one of the following types (your choice): Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder. On a successful save, the attacker takes half as much damage.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

Elemental Smite.name: Elemental Smite

Immediately after you cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDivineSmit]{Divine Smite}, you can expend one use of your @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.classes.Item.phbpdnChannelDiv]{Channel Divinity} and invoke one of the following effects.

Dao’s Crush. Earth rises up around the target of your Divine Smite. The target has the Grappled condition (escape DC equal to your spell save DC, [[/check]]). While &Reference[Grappled apply=false], the target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition.

Djinni’s Escape. You teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of yourself and take on a semi-incorporeal form, which lasts until the end of your next turn. While in this form, you have Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage, and you have Immunity to the Grappled, Prone, and Restrained conditions.

Efreeti’s Fury. The target of your Divine Smite takes an extra [[/damage]] damage, and fire jumps from the target to another creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself. The second creature also takes [[/damage]] damage.

Marid’s Surge. The target of your Divine Smite and each creature of your choice in a 10-foot Emanation originating from you make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature is pushed 15 feet straight away from you and has the &Reference[Prone] condition.

Scion of the Three.name: Scion of the Three
Scion of the Three.description:
Become a Gruesome Agent of Malice

A Scion of the Three draws power from a group of malevolent gods known in Baldur’s Gate as the Dead Three: Bane, a god of tyranny; Bhaal, a god of violence and murder; and Myrkul, a god of death. While some Rogues of this subclass pledge themselves ardently to those three macabre gods, others are thrust on this path by a curse. Either way, a scion’s power manifests as various occult gifts, as well as an uncanny talent for striking and terrifying foes.

Scions of the Three are most common in Baldur’s Gate, where the Dead Three lived as mortals before ascending to godhood. Underground cults to Bane, Bhaal, and Myrkul often count Scions of the Three among their most useful agents. Outside Baldur’s Gate, secular thieves’ guilds such as the Shadow Thieves of Amn or the Xanathar Guild in Waterdeep might call on a Scion of the Three to undertake an especially violent contract.

Songal's Elemental Suffusion.name: Songal's Elemental Suffusion
Songal's Elemental Suffusion.description:
You imbue yourself with the elemental power of genies. You gain the following benefits until the spell ends:

Elemental Immunity. When you cast this spell, choose one of the following damage types: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder. You have Resistance to the chosen damage type.

Elemental Pulse. When you cast this spell and at the start of each of your subsequent turns, you release a burst of elemental energy in a 15-foot Emanation originating from yourself. Each creature of your choice in that area makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d6 Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder damage (your choice) and has the Prone condition. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

For each secondary caster who participates in the casting, you can choose one additional creature, to a maximum of nine additional creatures. The chosen creatures also gain the benefits of the spell for its duration.

Foundry Note

After you use Terrify, use the Cunning Sneak Attack activity to roll your Sneak Attack damage. It automatically deducts 1d6 from your Sneak Attack dice for this roll (e.g., 5d6 → 4d6). You can choose the damage type in the damage roll dialog.

Spellfire Sorcery.name: Spellfire Sorcery
Spellfire Sorcery.description:
Wield Raw Magic

Your innate power stems from the source of magic itself: the Weave. This connection manifests as a rare ability known as spellfire, and you surge with radiant bursts of this raw magic. Your talent with spellfire allows you to heal allies, sear enemies, and absorb powerful spells.

Wielders of spellfire tend to have a penchant for wandering. Many travel between cosmopolitan settlements, such as those along the Sword Coast, and wield their magic in service of the common good. Others realize their own strange powers by roaming equally strange lands, from the magic-blasted wastes of the desert of Anauroch to the god-touched wilds of the Old Empires.
Wherever they go in the Realms, spellfire Sorcerers are courted by factions with interests in the arcane arts, such as the Harpers, Cult of the Dragon, and Red Wizards.

Spellfire Spark.name: Spellfire Spark
Spellfire Spark.description:
You gain the following benefits.

Magic Absorption. Once per turn, when you take damage from a spell or magical effect, you reduce the total damage taken by [[/heal]]{1d4}. You can’t use this benefit if you have the Incapacitated condition.

Spellfire Flame. You learn the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplSacredFlam]{Sacred Flame} cantrip. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell (choose when you select this feat). You can also cast this cantrip as a Bonus Action a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

Foundry Note

Magic Absorption is a healing activity that can be used after taking damage from a spell or magical effect.

Sacred Flame is automatically granted as part of the feat. This feat also allows you to cast Sacred Flame as a bonus action.

Spellfire Storm.name: Spellfire Storm
Spellfire Storm.description:
You conjure a pillar of spellfire in a 20-foot-radius, 20-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point within range. The area of the Cylinder is Bright Light, and each creature in it when it appears makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 4d10 Radiant damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature also makes this save when it enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

In addition, whenever a creature in the Cylinder casts a spell, that creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If that spell was cast with a spell slot, the slot isn’t expended.

When you cast this spell, you can designate creatures to be unaffected by it.

Casting as a Circle Spell. In addition to the spell’s usual components, you must provide a special component (a blue star sapphire worth 25,000+ GP), which the spell consumes. The spell’s range increases to 1 mile, and it no longer requires Concentration. When the spell is cast, each secondary caster must expend a level 3+ spell slot; otherwise, the spell fails.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d10 for every spell slot level above 4.

Crown of Spellfire.name: Crown of Spellfire
Crown of Spellfire.description:
When you use Innate Sorcery, you can alter it and infuse yourself with the essence of spellfire, gaining the following benefits while this use of Innate Sorcery is active. Once you use this feature to alter Innate Sorcery, you can’t use it again until you finish a Long Rest unless you spend 5 Sorcery Points (no action required) to restore your use of it.

Burning Life Force. Once per turn when you are hit by an attack roll, you can expend a number of Hit Point Dice, up to a maximum equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one). Roll the expended dice, and reduce the amount of damage from that attack equal to the total rolled.

Flight. You gain a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover.

Spell Avoidance. When you’re subjected to a spell or magical effect that allows you to make a saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the save and only half damage if you fail. You can’t use this benefit if you have the Incapacitated condition.

Foundry Note

The Activate Spellfire activity has several effects when used:

  1. It consumes one use of the feature.

  2. It changes the name of the activity from "Activate Spellfire" to "Disable Spellfire."

  3. It reveals the "Burning Lifeforce (d6)" activity in feature, allowing you to roll for damage reduction based on the number of hit dice (HD) you choose to consume, up to your Charisma modifier.

  4. It reveals the "Spell Avoidance" activity in the feature, which you can use while Crown of Spellfire is active. This sub-feature as no automation and requires manual adjudication to resolve.

Clicking on "Disable Spellfire" will hide the "Burning Lifeforce (d6)" and "Spell Avoidance" activities, and revert the name back to "Activate Spellfire."

Please note that the "Burning Lifeforce" activity will deduct Sorcerer denomination hit dice (d6). It will not consume hit dice of different denominations if you multiclass into a subclass that does not use d6.

While the spell is active, you gain the following benefits:

Climbing. You gain a Climb Speed equal to your Speed.

Venomous Bite. As a Magic action, you can make a ranged spell attack using the snake against one creature within 50 feet. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 Force damage and has the Poisoned condition until the start of your next turn. While Poisoned, the target has the Incapacitated condition.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. For each spell slot level above 3, the number of Temporary Hit Points you gain from this spell increases by 5, and the damage of Venomous Bite increases by 1d6.

Venom.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of your next turn. While Poisoned, the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition.

Tyro of the Gauntlet.description:
You gain the following benefits.

Stand as One. When an ally within 5 feet of you is subjected to an effect that would push or pull it, you can take a Reaction to prevent that ally from being pushed or pulled. To receive this benefit, the ally can’t have the Incapacitated condition.

Vigilant. When you take the &Reference[Ready]action, the next attack roll made against you has Disadvantage before the start of your next turn.

Wardaway.name: Wardaway
Wardaway.description:
You hurl a disorienting magical force toward one creature within range. The target makes a Constitution saving throw; Constructs and Undead automatically succeed on this save.

On a failed save, the target takes 2d4 Force damage, its Speed is halved until the start of your next turn, and on its next turn, it can take only an action or a Bonus Action (but not both). On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 2d4 for every spell slot level above 1.

Disoriented.description: On a failed save the target's Speed is halved until the start of your next turn, and on its next turn, it can take only an action or a Bonus Action (but not both).

Winter Walker.name: Winter Walker
Winter Walker.description:
Withstand the Horrors of Frigid Wastelands

Winter Walkers hone their craft in the bleak and frozen wilds of places like Icewind Dale. These ruthless, rimed Rangers hunt monsters that haunt arctic wastelands, eventually becoming frigid terrors themselves. Winter Walkers are well versed in the phenomena of Icewind Dale, including the latent magic of fallen Netherese cities, endemic monsters like yetis and crag cats, and the rising threat of Underdark invaders. Due to their cold pragmatism, terrifying magic, and mastery of the region, Winter Walkers are regarded with equal parts respect and fear. Ten-Towns citizens say that Winter Walkers’ frequent exposure to malignant entities gives them their fearsome powers. Many Reghed nomads, on the other hand, believe that nature spirits bestow on Winter Walkers a unique curse.

Chilling Retribution.name: Chilling Retribution
Chilling Retribution.description:
When a creature hits you with an attack roll, you can take a Reaction to force the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the target has the Stunned condition until the end of your next turn. While the target is Stunned, its Speed is reduced to 0 feet.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

Stunned (Chilled).description: The target has the Stunned condition until the end of your next turn. While the target is Stunned, its Speed is reduced to 0 feet.

Fortifying Soul.name: Fortifying Soul
Fortifying Soul.description:
Your experience surviving harrowing environments allows you to bolster your allies in addition to yourself. As a Magic action, choose a number of creatures you can see equal to your Wisdom modifier ([[lookup @abilities.wis.mod]]{0}, minimum of one). Each chosen creature regains Hit Points equal to [[/heal]]{1d10 plus your Ranger level} and has Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the Frightened condition for 1 hour.

Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a Long Rest.

Fortifying Soul.name: Fortifying Soul
Fortifying Soul.description: Each chosen creature has Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition for 1 hour.

Frigid Explorer.name: Frigid Explorer
Frigid Explorer.description:
You gain the following benefits.

Biting Cold. Damage from your weapon attacks, Ranger spells, and Ranger features ignores Resistance to Cold damage.

Frost Resistance. You have Resistance to Cold damage.

Polar Strikes. When you hit a creature with an attack roll using a weapon, you can deal an extra 1d4 Cold damage to the target, which can take this extra damage only once per turn. When you reach Ranger level 11, this extra damage increases to 1d6.

Foundry Note

This feature's extra damage can either be rolled individually via the Polar Strike activity, or as a toggled bonus via the Polar Strikes Damage active effect applying to all weapon damage rolls.

Polar Strike.name: Polar Strike
Polar Strike.condition: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack roll

Frozen Haunt.name: Frozen Haunt
Frozen Haunt.description:
When you cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHuntersMar]{Hunter's Mark}, you can adopt a ghostly, snowy form. This form lasts until the spell ends, and while you are in this form, you gain the following benefits. Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a Long Rest unless you expend a level 4+ spell slot (no action required).

Frozen Soul. You have Immunity to Cold damage. When you first adopt this form and at the start of each of your subsequent turns, each creature of your choice in a 15-foot Emanation originating from you takes [[/damage]] damage.

Partially Incorporeal. You have Immunity to the Grappled, Prone, and Restrained conditions. You can move through creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain, but you take [[/damage 1d10 force]] damage if you end your turn inside a creature or an object. If the form ends while you are inside a creature or an object, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space.

Hunter's Rime.name: Hunter's Rime
Hunter's Rime.description:
Ice rimes you and your prey, protecting you and hindering them. When you cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHuntersMar]{Hunter's Mark}, you gain Temporary Hit Points equal to [[/heal]]{1d10 plus your Ranger level}.

Additionally, while a creature is marked by your Hunter’s Mark, it can’t take the &Reference[Disengage] action.

Foundry Note

This feature's Rimed Hunter's Mark effect can be used in place of the spell's equivalent via the Heal and Apply Rime activity. The rimed mark can be transferred to a new creature via the Move Rimed Mark activity.

Zhentarim Mercenary.name: Zhentarim Mercenary
Zhentarim Mercenary.description:
Ability Scores: Strength, Dexterity, Charisma

Feat: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-heroes-faerun.options.Item.hofZhentarimRuff]{Zhentarim Ruffian} (see “@UUID[Compendium.dnd-heroes-faerun.book.JournalEntry.hofFeats00000000]{Feats}” later in this chapter)

Skill Proficiencies: Intimidation and Perception

Tool Proficiency: Forgery Kit

Equipment: Choose A or B: (A) @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbwepClub000000]{Club}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbwepDagger0000]{Dagger}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbtulForgeryKit]{Forgery Kit}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagClothesFine]{Fine Clothes}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.DKYzehYrMUKiFDxt]{Hooded Lantern}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagOil00000000]{Oil} (3 flasks), 2 @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagPouch000000]{Pouches}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagString00000]{String}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.equipment.Item.phbagTinderbox00]{Tinderbox}, [[/award 11GP]]; or (B) [[/award 50GP]]

Maybe you needed the money. Maybe you longed for a family, no matter how dubious. Or maybe you’re just good at getting the job done by any means necessary. Whatever your reason, you enlisted with the Zhentarim, the most notorious mercenary guild in the Realms. Though the Zhentarim’s leaders insist the organization is more like a family than a shadowy syndicate, few families exhibit as much dishonesty, nepotism, and corruption as this one. You’ve honed your cunning, reflexes, and blade to climb the guild’s ranks.

Background Ability Score Improvement.title: Background Ability Score Improvement
Background Ability Score Improvement.hint: Your background allows you to increase your Strength, Dexterity, and Charisma scores; increase one of them by 2 and a different one by 1, or increase all three by 1. None of these increases can raise a score above 20.

Choose Languages.title: Choose Languages
Choose Languages.hint: Your character knows at least three languages: Common plus two languages you roll or choose from the Standard Languages table.

Background Feat.title: Background Feat
Background Feat.hint: Your background grants you the Zhentarim Ruffian feat.

Zhentarim Ruffian.name: Zhentarim Ruffian
Zhentarim Ruffian.description:
You gain the following benefits.

Exploit Opening. When you roll damage for an &Reference[Opportunity Attacks]{Opportunity Attack}, you can roll the damage dice twice and use either roll against the target.

Family First. If you have Heroic Inspiration when you roll Initiative, you can expend it to give yourself and your allies Advantage on that Initiative roll.

Zhentarim Tactics.name: Zhentarim Tactics
Zhentarim Tactics.description:
You gain the following benefits.

Ability Score Increase. Increase your Dexterity or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Retaliate. Immediately after a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, you can make an &Reference[OpportunityAttacks] against that creature.

Versatile Merc. When you finish a Long Rest, choose a skill in which you have proficiency. You have Expertise in that skill until you finish your next Long Rest.
